title: Memoirs of Extraordinary Popular Delusions and the Madness of Crowds, Volume I
creator: Charles Mackay
description: Librivox recording of Memoirs of Extraordinary Popular Delusions and the Madness of Crowds, Volume I by Charles Mackay. Read by LibriVox Volunteers. The book chronicles and vilifies its targets in three parts: "National Delusions", "Peculiar Follies", and "Philosophical Delusions". The subjects of Mackay's debunking include alchemy, beards (influence of politics and religion on), witch-hunts, crusades and duels. Present day writers on economics, such as Andrew Tobias, laud the three chapters on economic bubbles. (summary from wikipedia) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. Download M4B Part 1 (135MB) Download M4B Part 2 (135MB) Download M4B Part 3 (128MB) For more free audiobooks, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit librivox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks; history; politics; alchemy; economic bubbles; magnetizers; delusions
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text

reviews.reviewbody:
THe book's title sounds a bit academic, but its about grand capers and conmen. It's like Enron and the Wall Street bailout, with some of the high-class grifters who used ot pretend to turn lead into gold.

I'm really glad to have listened to this book. It's well read, and fascinating.
reviews.reviewtitle: An excellent book about conmen taking whole cities, or even countries, on the long con.
